page.title: 12The Barrack and its Museum
page.content: The Barracks is situated in the Watton. It is being used for secret operations and has been equiped with the necessary security precautions. Adjoining the Barracks is a miltary museum which contains exhibits from the conflicts that the South Wales Borders Regiment has been involved in. The museum contains most of the Victoria Crosses received by the regiment; over 20 soldiers recieved this medal.In the Andaman Island in 1867 V.C.'s were presented for bravery to Assistant Surgeon Cambell Mills Douglas, Private Thomas Murphy, Private David Bell, Private William Griffiths and Private James Cooper.In Ashanti, in 1873 a medal was presented to Lieutenant Lord Clifford. In Zulu campaign in South Africa, in 1879 medals were presented to Lieutenant Nevill Josiah Coophill, Lieutentant
